thread.title: Disneyland launches a 'Star Wars' fest in Tomorrowland
thread.title_full: Disneyland launches a 'Star Wars' fest in Tomorrowland

author:
Jackie Burrell

jburrell@bayareanewsgroup.com
title: Disneyland launches a 'Star Wars' fest in Tomorrowland
text: Disneyland launches a 'Star Wars' fest in Tomorrowland By Jackie Burrell Posted: 10/20/2015 12:00:00 PM PDT Updated: 10/21/2015 12:06:13 PM PDT Imperial Stormtroopers guard the Metreon during a Koret Family House benefit and premiere of "Star Wars: Episode III Revenge of the Sith" in San Francisco. (Ron Lewis/Bay Area News Group archives) More 'Star Wars' news Force fest Disney's new Star Wars Land is still a parsec or two in the future (construction begins next year), but Walt & Co. just unveiled plans for a Season of the Force festival that begins Nov. 16 in Tomorrowland. Space Mountain will get space-ier as X-wings battle it out in "Hyperspace Mountain." A scene from the upcoming "Star Wars: The Force Awakens" flick will be added to the Star Tours ride. And Innoventions, that big round never-quite-knew-what-it-was building is being turned into the Star Wars Launch Bay, with stormtrooper and starship exhibits, Jedi Knight displays and photo ops with Darth Vader and Chewie. Advertisement
